required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Uterine Artery Doppler Changes Prior and After Breastfeeding
clinical_study.official_title: Postpartum Uterine Artery Doppler Changes Prior and After Breastfeeding

brief_summary.textblock: We aim to determine whether there are any differences in the UtA doppler measurements in postpartum women prior and right after breastfeeding.

detailed_description.textblock: There is emerging evidence linking abnormal UtA Doppler indices in the postpartum period as a risk factor for developing future cardiovascular disorders. Thus far, no study considered the postpartum physiology itself as a possible confounder. If one wishes to draw conclusions about future cardiovascular risk, the role of oxytocin as a confounder must be determined. In the current study, we aim to determine whether oxytocin, physiologically produced during breastfeeding, has an effect on the UtA Doppler measurements in the postpartum period.

primary_outcome.measure: Postpartum uterine artery doppler changes prior and after breastfeeding.
primary_outcome.description: To determine whether there are any differences in the UtA doppler measurements in postpartum women prior and right after breastfeeding.

arm_group.description: Measurements of the UtA doppler postpartum ultrasound will be carried out twice for each eligible woman on the second day postpartum. The first measurement will take place just prior to a planned breastfeeding. The second measurement will be followed immediately (within 10 min) after the breastfeeding session.

Measurements of the UtA doppler postpartum ultrasound will be carried out twice for each eligible woman on the second day postpartum. The first measurement will take place just prior to a planned breastfeeding. The second measurement will be followed immediately (within 10 min) after the breastfeeding session.

intervention.description: Measurements of the UtA doppler ultrasound will be carried out twice for each eligible woman on the second day postpartum. The first measurement will take place just prior to a planned breastfeeding. The second measurement will be followed immediately (within 10 min) after the breastfeeding session.

study_pop.textblock: Every woman who had vaginal delivery, instrumental delivery or cesarean section.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Every woman who had vaginal delivery, instrumental delivery or cesarean section.
Exclusion Criteria:
-Patient's refusal, women who decided not to breastfeed, women who wish to breastfeed, but in whom no milk production commenced yet.
